data.title: Breakfast
data.text: I wanted a delicious breakfast and good coffee without a long wait. I enjoyed a Create-Your-Own omelette served with red potatoes and fresh-baked bread and cafe au lait. Parfait!

data.title: Ooo La La
data.text: We go here before the movies. They have a cute little outside seating area and the food is pretty good. Their big draw is the bakery though. Stop in and get cookies to take to the show.

data.title: Worst breakfast ever
data.text: Soggy nasty breakfast panini with barely cooked bacon. The whole thing was an inedible little disaster. Ordered iced coffee, was charged for a latte. Thumbs way down.

data.title: Good place to sit outside with coffee and pastry
data.text: This place has good coffee, a nice outdoor dining area, and very nice pastries.Reasonably priced.Good place to meet friends or read Sunday morning paper.

data.title: My favorite little cafe..
data.text:
I love this location because they have more tables than the other place at the Woodbridge Center. 

They serve very good coffee, which is little more testier than those big chains. The food is very good also! Love love love their dressing on the salad; it has little curry taste to it. 

I wish we have more cafe like this in southern OC..

data.title: Outdoor treat
data.text: If it feels like Pari it is supposed to. As such I would sit outside. Maybe not, if it was pouring, but if it was pouring we wouldn't be here. And like the Saint Germain, I'd stick to pastry and a coffee. Maybe a quiche, but this place is not set up for gourmet. What you want is suburban escape

data.title: Nice refreshing stop
data.text: While on a recent trip to California my wife and I walked from the John Wayne Airport to the South Coast Plaza (it was quite a hike!). We wandered the mall for a while and decided to walk the Bridge of Gardens connecting the two parts of the mall. It was there that we discovered the Champagne French Bakery and enjoyed some iced tea and pastries. Wonderful spot!

data.title: Always reliable, good food
data.text: This is a place I often meet friends at fir breakfast, lunch, or even coffee.  The food is good, the prices are fair, seating indoors and out.  Outside is fog friendly, I have met many canine oaks there!

data.title: Good place to meet for coffee
data.text: My friend I meet here periodically for a long chat and have great cup of coffee and delicious almond croissant.

data.title: Good quality but diminishing quantity
data.text:
Have been going here for years but of late we have slowed down our visits.

Price - value relationship is no longer great. Portions seems smaller and half sandwich or bowl seems like it's shrunk by 20%.

Baked goods are great quality.

data.title: Pleasant discovery
data.text: Discovered it by chance.  Stopped for breakfast, and ordered the spinach, feta quiche.  Enough for two breakfasts.  Near a well traveled walking bridge, so there were plenty of people coming and going.  I sat outside, always preferable to me, and had the quick, a cappuccino and a nice breeze.  I'm going back.

data.title: Not impressed
data.text: My friend and I went back to Champaign French cafe this morning for the second time. I got the breakfast sandwich: Egg, cheese, and bacon on a croissant.  It lacked flavor and I was not impressed.  The last time I was there I got two eggs and bacon. I was not impressed with it either.

data.title: A decent attempt at being European; good for a light lunch
data.text: This little café in the Woodbridge Village shopping center turned out to be better than I expected.  I ordered a tuna salad sandwich and got something that really did resemble a type of sandwich I’d get in France, perhaps not as fresh, but satisfying enough.  The bread was pretty decent.  I have yet to try any pastries.  Order at the counter, then wait for staff to bring your food to you.  There are a few seats inside, but we sat outside, which is recommended if the weather is nice and you can find a table.  $13 for the sandwich and an Orangina; perhaps a little pricey but not budget-busing by OC standards.

data.title: Rubbery Chicken!
data.text: Went there today for late lunch and ordered the Garlic Chicken Panini with fries from the hot sandwiches and a lemon cookie to go as I was working. The chicken was rubbery, the bread was stale, and the fries were anemic! The food was so bad that I dumped it in the trash bin as I did not have time to take it back. I was mad because I was hungry and spent over $12 on a lunch that was not worth a dollar! If you cannot cook your chicken properly, why are you offering such an item on the menu???  This was a colossal failure! My recommendation is to avoid this joint, period.

data.title: Champagne French Bakery Cafe - Northwood - Irvine, CA
data.text:
Who needs to fly to Paris to enjoy a wonderful little French Bakery when one can simply drive over of one of two fabulous Champagne French Bakery Cafes in Irvine?  

The Irvine Northwood location is quietly situated at the corner of Irvine Blvd. & Central Park Avenue ... with quaint but slightly cramped seating inside but with ample outdoor tables with large green shaded umbrellas.

The deserts they serve are sinfully delicious and if you let it slip out that it happens to be your birthday, one of the nice waitresses shall happily bring you an extra piece of desert ... pretty nice of them.

The sandwiches and specialty salads are good as are the quiches but that's not really why most people ... friends, couples, and lots and lots of young families with kids ... frequent this small eatery. You'll figure out the real reason after your first visit. The attached photos tell the rest of the story.
Bon appetit !
SC (3-28-14)

data.title: Stick to the Pastry
data.text: My roommate and I went to Champagne this morning to celebrate her birthday. We'd been wanting to try it ever since we reviewed the menu. Everything sounded great! She had the breakfast sandwich and I tried the pesto chicken and goat cheese omelet. Her sandwich looked good... lots of egg along with the herbed cream cheese and avocado, and the wheat bun looked soft and fresh. My omelet, unfortunately, was a different story. It wasn't warm, and the omelet itself didn't look freshly cooked. The chicken was tough and chewy, also just lukewarm. The best things on my plate were the country red potatoes (tender and well-seasoned) and the french baguette (crispy on the outside and tender inside). I also ordered a white chocolate mocha, but when I took my first sip I couldn't detect even a hint of sweetness. I took it back inside and explained my dilemma to the waitress and asked if they would replace it with something else, like a hot chocolate. To their credit, they took care of it, no questions asked. Since it was my roommate's birthday, we decided to splurge and we split a custard brioche. Wonderful! It was light and flaky, and not overly sweet. I'm willing to go back and try their soups and salads, but my overall impression is that their best offerings are their pastries. Everything in the case looked amazing, and considering that my baguette, my roommate's sandwich bread, and our brioche didn't disappoint, my assessment is probably spot on. If you're looking for place to read the paper while enjoying coffee and pastry, then Champagne offers a casual and comfortable atmosphere with its outdoor patio setting.

data.title: フランス風
data.text: 緑のおおきなパラソルが目印。地元の方でにぎわっていました。メニューはどことなくフランス風で、クレープやキッシュが充実です。チキンのクレープは、クリームソース味のチキンとホウレン草が入ったクレープ。クレープ生地がほんのり甘くて　とてもバランスよかったです。
